medium: Black chalk and charcoal, heightened with white chalk, with stumping and touches of red chalk, on tan laid paper prepared with a medium brown wash
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895

titles.title: Studies for Saint Sebastian: Thigh of Right Leg; Whole Left Leg with Separate Studies for Thigh, Lower Leg, and Foot

makers.displaymaker: Federico Barocci, 1535–1612; born and died Urbino, Italy

texts.textentryhtml:
From Mongan, “Drawings in the Platt collection”: Preliminary studies for the figure of St. Sebastian in the “Crucifixion” of Genoa Cathedral. (See reference Bib. 4472);


From Scholz, “Italian drawings…”: same level as spectacular example in Metropolitan or Head of Lady at Smith. (See reference Bib. 4382);

caption: Federico Barocci (1535–1612; born and died Urbino, Italy), Studies for Saint Sebastian, ca. 1592–96. Black chalk and charcoal, heightened with white chalk, with stumping and touches of red chalk, on tan laid paper prepared with a medium brown wash; 41.7 × 27.3 cm, 61 × 45.7 × 3.5 cm (frame). Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895 (x1948-599)
